title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.1: INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY OF MOSD

description.narrative: By end ot 2018, the organisational and institutional capacity of the Ministry of Social Development (MOSD) is strengthened to deliver effective welfare and protection services to vulnerable children and their families, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 4. Protective environment strengthened for children at risk of and exposed to violence, exploitation and abuse.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: Increasing number of children had their births registered and were issued with a certificate. This was made possible through strengthening the organizational and institutional capacity of the Ministry of Social Development. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018
